alert.note: Alert for Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Clark, Pike and central Hot Spring Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 859 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Narrows Dam, or near Murfreesboro, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Murfreesboro... Gurdon... Amity... Caddo Valley... Okolona... Daisy... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Halfway... Crater Of Diamonds State Park... Narrows Dam... Richwoods... DeGray Lake State Park... Daisy State Park... Delight... Antoine... Billstown... Alpine... Curtis... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.
